The Extended Integer (XInt) Library

The Different Integer Types

The main integer class in this library is boost::xint::integer. It allows for arbitrary-length numbers, limited only by your system's memory. There is an error-code-based variant of it as well, boost::xint::nothrow_integer, and a fixed-length type (boost::xint::fixed_integer), where you to specify the number of bits to limit it to.

All three types are defined as templates, and can be instantiated with different allocators, with or without thread safety, and optionally with memory erasure for high-security applications.

All three types have an essentially identical set of functions and operators, and can do pretty much the same things, though with different time and memory efficiencies. See the "detailed description" portion of the reference pages linked above for a description of each type and its unique properties.
